<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/02/09/new-york-other-blue-states-announce-plans-to-drop-mask-mandates?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Life could soon look a lot more ‘normal’
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/02/09/new-york-other-blue-states-announce-plans-to-drop-mask-mandates?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="SNL scene of social distancing" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=375 src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2022-02-09/image-52d680b9309e33214a9204a283826c9b9edb534b-480x268-gif/giphy(8).gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="SNL scene of social distancing" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://images.morningbrew.com/gif/2022-02-09/image-52d680b9309e33214a9204a283826c9b9edb534b-480x268-gif/giphy(8).gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Saturday Night Live/NBC via Giphy</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’re about to find out how many of you have been slacking with the toothbrush during the pandemic.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">New York is <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/new-york-state-to-drop-indoor-mask-mandate-11644419799?mod=hp_lead_pos6" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">scrapping</a> its indoor mask mandate for businesses today, joining a wave of other states that have recently announced plans to lift mask requirements in indoor settings or schools.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Oregon, California, Rhode Island, Delaware, Connecticut, Massachusetts, and New Jersey all said this week that masks can soon come off in a variety of places, due to a plunge in new Covid cases.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Notice a pattern?</strong> All these states are Democratic strongholds, which throughout the pandemic have introduced more aggressive Covid policies than their red-state counterparts.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It shows that more leaders are resigned to the fact that Covid is here to stay—but thanks to a mix of vaccinations, prior infections, and effective treatments it hopefully can be kept at manageable levels without requiring significant interventions.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“This is not a declaration of victory as much as an acknowledgment that we can responsibly live with this thing,” NJ Gov. Phil Murphy said.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Now, Covid gets local</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As states lift mask mandates, more of the power around Covid restrictions will shift to local governments, which will need to decide what’s best for their communities.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>New York City, for example, is keeping its vaccination requirement for indoor settings in place for now.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Los Angeles County is keeping its mask mandate, despite the state’s move to lift it.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And that reflects where this whole thing is going. As the country <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/3800e619-3404-4e57-a9eb-dab311405c2a?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">moves out</a> of the “full blown” phase of the pandemic, “decisions will increasingly be made on a local level rather than centrally decided or mandated,” Dr. Fauci told the FT this week.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Speaking of central decisions…</strong>health officials at the federal level are being more cautious than individual states, citing still-high death rates and feeling burned from the emergence of new variants when we thought Covid was done and dusted.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BUSINESS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/02/09/house-speaker-nancy-pelosi-backed-a-ban-on-stock-trading-by-members-of-congress-with-conditions?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Tour de headlines
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>

<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/02/09/house-speaker-nancy-pelosi-backed-a-ban-on-stock-trading-by-members-of-congress-with-conditions?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Tour de headlines " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/3d0a6241809baac8db96c8717497893bd7ac7b9b-5469x3521.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Saul Loeb/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/chart-with-upwards-trend_1f4c8.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> <strong style="color:#000">Nancy Pelosi backed a stock trading ban in Congress. </strong>The House speaker, who had previously defended members of Congress trading individual stocks, said she’d now be <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2022/02/09/us/politics/pelosi-stock-trading-congress.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">open to a ban</a> after getting heat on the issue from other Democrats. What that law will eventually look like is unclear, but Pelosi said she wanted trading restrictions to extend to the Supreme Court, along with the executive branch.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/roller-coaster_1f3a2.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> <strong style="color:#000">Disney rode high last quarter, </strong>in no small part thanks to Disney adults chugging Jedi Mind Tricks at Oga’s Cantina. Disney’s parks have <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2022/02/09/disney-dis-fiscal-q1-2022-earnings.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rebounded</a> in a big way, raking in $7.2 billion in revenue compared to $3.6 billion the year before. In even more promising news, Disney+ added more subscribers than expected, despite execs warning that the best original content won’t arrive until later this year. Disney’s stock shot up 8% after the report.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/high-voltage-sign_26a1.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> <strong style="color:#000">A big step forward in fusion energy. </strong>UK scientists said they were able to generate 59 megajoules of fusion energy in a period of five seconds, and if that sounds like a lot, it is—it <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/science-environment-60312633?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">smashed the previous record</a> by nearly 2x. Not to be confused with nuclear fission (which splits atoms and is used in existing nuclear plants), nuclear <em>fusion </em>smashes atoms together, potentially giving humans a nearly limitless clean power source.—<em>NF, JW</em></p>
</div>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/beijing-olympics-figure-skating-medal-ceremony-delay-legal-issue?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Olympics hold the gold
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>

<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/beijing-olympics-figure-skating-medal-ceremony-delay-legal-issue?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Gold medalists of team ROC pose for a group photo during the flower ceremony of the figure skating team event at Capital Indoor Stadium in Beijing, capital of China, Feb. 7, 2022." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/fd1052790d6c9cbe09e297e9879c69a2c6c6d78f-5000x3334.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Xinhua News Agency/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It wouldn’t be Olympic figure skating without a tinge of scandal. The Russian skaters who placed first in the team event Monday have yet to receive their gold medals after the International Olympic Committee (IOC) <a href="https://www.npr.org/2022/02/09/1079512063/olympics-figure-skating-medals-russia-kamila-valieva?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> there was a “legal issue” that could affect the final podium.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Russian media sites and US outlets like USA Today report the issue is a positive drug test from one of the Russian team members, potentially 15-year-old Kamila Valieva—who made history this weekend for becoming the first woman to land a quadruple jump at the Olympics.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Neither the Russian presidential spokesman nor the IOC have confirmed the rumors.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Russia is already on thin ice.</strong> In 2019, the country was banned from international competition for four years after carrying out one of the biggest doping scandals in sports history. Russian athletes are allowed to compete in the Games, but only as the “Russian Olympic Committee” (ROC).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">While that gets sorted out…</strong>here’s what else is going down in Beijing:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Chloe Kim defended her halfpipe gold medal with a dominating performance. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"> </li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The Olympics </span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/2022/02/09/1079483004/bing-dwen-dwen-winter-olympics-mascot?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">breakout star</a></span><span>: a fluffy panda mascot named Bing Dwen Dwen, which roughly translates to “ice chubster.”</span><span><em>—MM</em></span>
</li>
</ul>
</div>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD & BEV
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/treasury-alcohol-industry-remedy-anticompetitive-practices?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Big Alcohol might need a drink after reading this
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/treasury-alcohol-industry-remedy-anticompetitive-practices?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Big beer shadowing little beers" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/592cfa09d0dd6cffaabae2cdf3d10c5e1134c272-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Not the sexiest way to do a roast, but the Treasury Department released a 63-page doc yesterday calling out the alcohol industry for <a href="https://www.reuters.com/business/exclusive-treasury-wants-stir-up-us-alcohol-market-help-smaller-players-2022-02-09/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">anti-competitive practices</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For one, the Treasury said that mergers and acquisitions need to be scrutinized more before getting the green light from regulators. In the beer space in particular, Anheuser-Busch InBev and Molson Coors control about 65% of the market by revenue, per the report.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Treasury also called out how Prohibition-era rules have distorted free-market pricing:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Post-and-hold” laws require alcohol companies to post their prices and hold them for a period of time ranging from seven days to a year.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In many states, suppliers are required to go through distributors, instead of being allowed to sell direct. Smaller sellers argue distributors favor major brands for prime shelf space.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why is the Treasury beefing? </strong>Limited competition could be jacking up the price of your favorite nanobrewery’s IPA. And rising prices are a key concern for President Biden, who signed an executive order in July to fight “excess consolidation” across industries, from meatpacking to tech.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>For all the concerns about anti-competitive practices, anyone who’s been to a Whole Foods recently can speak to the explosion of smaller breweries. 6,400 breweries currently operate in the US, up from 89 in the late 1970s.<em>—JW</em></p>
</div>

GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/02/09/key-performance-indicators?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Key performance indicators

</h1>

<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/02/09/key-performance-indicators?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Unicorn" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/1fce65ef42811ea3d7a77cc8ae83345c09e970cd-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>When the product management software firm Productboard announced a funding round last week, little did it know it was <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2022-02-09/there-are-now-1-000-unicorn-private-company-startups-worth-1-billion-or-more?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">making startup history</a> as the 1,000th unicorn (startup valued at at least $1 billion) in the world, according to CB Insights. There were only 39 unicorns identified in 2013. Now, unicorns are collectively worth nearly $3.3 trillion.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“We believe women’s breasts in all shapes and sizes deserve support and comfort. Which is why our new sports bra range contains 43 styles, so everyone can find the right fit for them.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Adidas highlighted its new collection of sports bras by <a href="https://www.yahoo.com/lifestyle/adidas-breasts-sports-bra-collection-191219739.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tweeting</a> a photo grid of 25 different pairs of bare boobs, earning both praise and pushback across the internet. In response to criticism, the company defended the post by arguing, “It’s important to normalize the human body,” and since this is the first time we’ve used the word “boobs” in the newsletter, guess it worked.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>The older we get, the more we need our friends—and the harder it is to keep them. (<a href="https://www.theatlantic.com/magazine/archive/2022/03/why-we-lose-friends-aging-happiness/621305/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Atlantic</a>)</p>
</div>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brew Mini: </strong>Continuing our Super Bowl-themed week of puzzles, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/02/09/brew-super-sized-mini?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">try out today’s Mini</a>…which comes with a Super-sized twist.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Three headlines and a lie</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Three of these news headlines are real and one is faker than pretending you’re not excited for the <a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/tv/tv-news/futurama-revived-at-hulu-1235090020/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Futurama</em> revival</a>. color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nLife could soon look a lot more ‘normal’\n\u003c/font\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca class=\"source\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eSaturday Night Live/NBC via Giphy\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe’re about to find out how many of you have been slacking with the toothbrush during the pandemic.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNew York is \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/new-york-state-to-drop-indoor-mask-mandate-11644419799?mod=hp_lead_pos6\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003escrapping\u003c/a\u003e its indoor mask mandate for businesses today, joining a wave of other states that have recently announced plans to lift mask requirements in indoor settings or schools.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOregon, California, Rhode Island, Delaware, Connecticut, Massachusetts, and New Jersey all said this week that masks can soon come off in a variety of places, due to a plunge in new Covid cases.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNotice a pattern?\u003c/strong\u003e All these states are Democratic strongholds, which throughout the pandemic have introduced more aggressive Covid policies than their red-state counterparts.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt shows that more leaders are resigned to the fact that Covid is here to stay—but thanks to a mix of vaccinations, prior infections, and effective treatments it hopefully can be kept at manageable levels without requiring significant interventions.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e“This is not a declaration of victory as much as an acknowledgment that we can responsibly live with this thing,” NJ Gov. Phil Murphy said.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNow, Covid gets local\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs states lift mask mandates, more of the power around Covid restrictions will shift to local governments, which will need to decide what’s best for their communities.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNew York City, for example, is keeping its vaccination requirement for indoor settings in place for now.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLos Angeles County is keeping its mask mandate, despite the state’s move to lift it.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd that reflects where this whole thing is going. As the country \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/3800e619-3404-4e57-a9eb-dab311405c2a?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emoves out\u003c/a\u003e of the “full blown” phase of the pandemic, “decisions will increasingly be made on a local level rather than centrally decided or mandated,” Dr. Fauci told the FT this week.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSpeaking of central decisions…\u003c/strong\u003ehealth officials at the federal level are being more cautious than individual states, citing still-high death rates and feeling burned from the emergence of new variants when we thought Covid was done and dusted.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS without a tinge of scandal. The Russian skaters who placed first in the team event Monday have yet to receive their gold medals after the International Olympic Committee (IOC) \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2022/02/09/1079512063/olympics-figure-skating-medals-russia-kamila-valieva?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e there was a “legal issue” that could affect the final podium.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRussian media sites and US outlets like USA Today report the issue is a positive drug test from one of the Russian team members, potentially 15-year-old Kamila Valieva—who made history this weekend for becoming the first woman to land a quadruple jump at the Olympics.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNeither the Russian presidential spokesman nor the IOC have confirmed the rumors.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRussia is already on thin ice.\u003c/strong\u003e In 2019, the country was banned from international competition for four years after carrying out one of the biggest doping scandals in sports history. Russian athletes are allowed to compete in the Games, but only as the “Russian Olympic Committee” (ROC).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhile that gets sorted out…\u003c/strong\u003ehere’s what else is going down in class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Big beer shadowing little beers\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/592cfa09d0dd6cffaabae2cdf3d10c5e1134c272-1500x1000.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNot the sexiest way to do a roast, but the Treasury Department released a 63-page doc yesterday calling out the alcohol industry for \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/business/exclusive-treasury-wants-stir-up-us-alcohol-market-help-smaller-players-2022-02-09/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eanti-competitive practices\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor one, the Treasury said that mergers and acquisitions need to be scrutinized more before getting the green light from regulators. In the beer space in particular, Anheuser-Busch InBev and Molson Coors control about 65% of the market by revenue, per the report.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Treasury also called out how Prohibition-era rules have distorted free-market pricing:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“Post-and-hold” laws require alcohol companies to post their prices and hold them for a period of time ranging from seven days to a year.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn many states, suppliers are required to go through distributors, instead of being allowed to sell direct. Smaller sellers argue distributors favor major brands for prime shelf space.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy is the Treasury beefing? \u003c/strong\u003eLimited competition could be jacking up the price of your favorite nanobrewery’s IPA. And rising prices are a key concern for President Biden, who signed an executive order in July to fight “excess consolidation” across industries, from meatpacking to tech.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eFor all the concerns about anti-competitive practices, anyone who’s been to a Whole Foods recently can speak to the explosion of smaller breweries. 6,400 breweries currently operate in the US, up from 89 in the late 1970s.\u003cem\u003e—JW\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\"
